solution_line_template: Pulling a loaded sled at {loaded_speed} mph for {loaded_distance_part1} miles takes {loaded_distance_part1}/{loaded_speed}=<<{loaded_distance_part1}/{loaded_speed}={time_loaded_part1}>>{time_loaded_part1} hours

Pulling an unloaded sled at {unloaded_speed} mph for {unloaded_distance_part1} miles takes {unloaded_distance_part1}/{unloaded_speed}=<<{unloaded_distance_part1}/{unloaded_speed}={time_unloaded_part1}>>{time_unloaded_part1} hours

Pulling a loaded sled at {loaded_speed} mph for {loaded_distance_part2} miles takes {loaded_distance_part2}/{loaded_speed}=<<{loaded_distance_part2}/{loaded_speed}={time_loaded_part2}>>{time_loaded_part2} hours

Pulling an unloaded sled at {unloaded_speed} mph for {unloaded_distance_part2} miles takes {unloaded_distance_part2}/{unloaded_speed}=<<{unloaded_distance_part2}/{unloaded_speed}={time_unloaded_part2}>>{time_unloaded_part2} hours

In total, Toby will have pulled the sled for {time_loaded_part1}+{time_unloaded_part1}+{time_loaded_part2}+{time_unloaded_part2}=<<{time_loaded_part1}+{time_unloaded_part1}+{time_loaded_part2}+{time_unloaded_part2}={total_time}>>{total_time} hours
